td.content: s:50 year old male technical writer presents RT hip having massive compound fracture with accompanying critical lack of feeling in right leg and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 167 cm, Weight 71.7 kg, Temperature 36.7 C, Pulse 70, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 18, irreversibly demolished hip a:white male technical writer aged 50 yrs presents with traumatic blunt injury to RT hip p:administered dilaudid - 1 mg IV q 2-3h prn. May repeat if no relief in 30min, ancef - 1 gm IV q 8 hours, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and referred patient to orthopedics.

Term.SYMPTOM: Loss of capacity to feel emotions

Value.Value: E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

content2.Value: E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,
orthopedics

td.content: s:50 yr old white M presents for follow-up on amputated r hip from approx. one (1) week ago. pt complained of severe swelling at the amputation site and severe stump pain. patient denied any fall or trauma. NKDA. he states he has never smoked a cigarette in his life denies any alcohol use o:Height 165 cm, Weight 69 kg, Temperature 36.5 C, Pulse 69, SystolicBP 104, DiastolicBP 62, Respiration 15, large wound, No bone visible in the wound at this time a:Disarticulation of right hip status p:performed Global postoperative visit - Completed, and prescribed vicodin HP 10-300 - 1 tab PO q 4 hours prn pain, ordered BMP, rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of right hip, and referred patient to therapy, physical.

content2.Unmatched: his life denies any alcohol use

Value.Value: Global postoperative visit

content2.Value: Global postoperative visit
Complete

Value.Value: ordered BMP , rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of right hip ,

content2.Value: ordered BMP , rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of right hip ,

Value.Value: therapy , physical

content2.Value: therapy , physical

td.content: s:white m aged 50 ys amputation patient (RT hip removed 2 weeks ago) presents for physical therapy visit. patient reports no issues o:, Extremity = no redness, no pus, good strength; Treatment provided: 1. Aerobic exercise to increase endurance 2. Hip extension, Hip abduction/adduction 3. mobility 4. Balance 5. Skin care a:Disarticulation of right hip status p:Begin sessions every three days until improvement in condition. performed Physical therapy evaluation - Completed; rehabilitation and remedial exercises following disarticulation of right hip - patient tolerated treatment well, showed increased ROM and strength.

content2.Unmatched: weeks ago) presents for physical therapy visit
, no pus , good strength; Treatment provided:
Begin sessions every three days until improvement
